intro: Sphaerolobium vimineum, commonly known as the slender sphaerolobium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant has slender, climbing stems that often twine around other vegetation. Its small, pea-like flowers are typically pale yellow to green, and it produces small, hairy pods containing seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in shrubland or coastal areas.
